translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders

analyzed: mahāvibhaṅga  sekhiya kaṇḍa  sak kacca vagga
translated: The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules
The sub-chapter on respectfully🔽The training rule on mouthfuls

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dīghaṁ ālopaṁ karonti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū dīgham ālopam karonti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six made long mouthfuls. …

analyzed: parimaṇḍalam ālopam karissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will make a round mouthful,’ this is how you should train.”
One should make a round mouthful.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca dīghaṁ ālopaṁ karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca dīgham ālopam karoti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes a long mouthful, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: anāpatti  a san cit ca  assatiyā
translated: There is no offense🔽if it is unintentional,
if he is not thinking,🔽if he does not know,🔽if he is sick,
if it is fruit,🔽if it is a special occasion,
if he is the first offender.🔽The tenth training rule is finished.
The fourth sub-chapter on respectfully is finished.
